meanings.sent1: The wolves outhowl in the forest at night.
meanings.sent2: The dogs outhowl when they hear a siren.
meanings.sent3: The wind seemed to outhowl through the trees, mimicking the wolves' calls.
meanings.sent4: His laughter outhowled the noise of the party, making everyone turn to look.
meanings.sent5: The singer's voice outhowled the sound of the crashing waves, captivating the audience.

meanings.definition: A loud howling sound coming from outside.
meanings.sent1: The outhowl of the wind kept me awake all night.
meanings.sent2: The eerie outhowl of a distant wolf echoed through the valley.
meanings.sent3: The outhowl of the neighbor's dog startled the birds in the trees.
meanings.sent4: The outhowl of the storm outside made the windows rattle.
meanings.sent5: The haunting outhowl of the night sent shivers down my spine.
